page.title: 02ROCKINGHAMS FARM L.MARNEY
page.content: Mr and Mrs J Black are arable farmers. They used to keep pigs, cows and a bull. They originally lived in Scotland. 20 years ago they grew sugar beet, potatoes and barley. Now they grow oil seed rape and wheat. They own a lot of machines - two combines, eight tractors, one plough, one draining machine, harrows, rollers, seed drills, fertilizer sreader, digger, hedge cutter, trailers and an old lorry which is used to cart grain. The land is very heavy clay. The farm belonged to St. Bartholmew's hospital in 1840 and it was 158 acres. Now it is 1300 acres. Mr. Black, his two sons, two full-time workers and a student do the work. In 1959 nine men did the work. The farm was much smaller then. The house is about 150 years old. They have lived here since 1959.
